TABREF2.text: Key clinical trials for COVID-19 treatments that are currently under way.
TABREF2.html:
ACTT [22] Convalescent Plasma EAP [33] CORIMUNO-TOCI [39] Regeneron [40]
Trial ID NCT04280705 NCT0433860 NCT0433180839 NCT04315298
Study agent Remdesivir Convalescent plasma Tocilizumab Sarilumab
Study location International USA France USA
Study design Adaptive, double-blind, placebo RCT Open-label expanded access program Open-label RCT Adaptive, phase 2/3, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled
Patients 1063 5000 129 457
Median age, yr (range) Not reported 62.3 (18.5-97.8) Not reported Not reported
Male patients Not reported 3153 (63.1%) Not reported Not reported
Disease status Not reported Severe or life-threatening: 4051 Moderate or severe (number not reported) Severe: 28%
  (81%)  Critical: 49%
  High risk of disease progression: 949 (19%)  MOD: 23%
Baseline clinical status Not reported Total ICU admissions: 3316 (66%) Respiratory failure: 2912 (72%) MOD/failure: 745 (18.4%) All patients required O2 supplementation, but levels not specified Not reported
Clinical improvement Median time to recovery: remdesivir 11 d vs placebo 15 d (p < 0.001) Septic shock: 600 (14.8%) Significantly lower proportion of patients in tocilizumab arm met primary outcome (need for NIV or MV) at day 14 All patients met primary endpoint (% change in CRP): 21% placebo vs 77% sarilumab 200 mg vs 79% sarilumab 400 mg Clinical improvement (critical): 18 (41%) placebo vs 48 (51%) sarilumab 200 mg vs 52 (59%) sarilumab 400 mg
Not reported
Death Remdesivir 8.0%; 7-d mortality rate: 14.9% Significantly lower proportion of patients in tocilizumab arm Critical: 12 (27%) placebo vs 34
placebo 11.6%  (36%) sarilumab 200 mg vs 20
 (p = 0.059)  met primary outcome (death) at day 14 (23%) sarilumab 400 mg
Serious adverse events Not reported 4 h after transfusion: 36 (<1%) including transfusion-associated circulatory overload (7); transfusion-related acute lung injury (11); severe allergic transfusion reactions Not reported No new safety signals
Limitations Press release with limited preliminary data; not peer-reviewed No control group; study not designed to assess efficacy of convalescent plasma care unit; MOD = multisystem organ Press release with limited preliminary data; not peer-reviewed Press release with limited preliminary data; not peer-reviewed dysfunction; MV = mechanical ventilation; NIV = noninvasive ventilation;
   CRP = C-reactive protein; ICU = intensive
